intro: Paepalanthus exiguus, commonly known as the small spurge or dwarf spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
